Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, EmpiricalNullDistributionComputer
    public class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2
extends MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov

    Computes the differential mutual information of two given multivariate sets of observations (implementing MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate), using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see Kraskov et al., below), algorithm 2. Most of the functionality is defined by the parent class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, and expanded on in MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.

    References:

    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www), Ipek Ã–zdemir

    • Method Detail

      • partialComputeFromObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromObservations​(int startTimePoint,
                                                  int numTimePoints,
                                                  boolean returnLocals)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data.

        The method returns:

        1. for average MIs (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_x+1) and digamma(n_y+1) for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local MIs (returnLocals == true), the array of local MI values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromObservations in class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of sum of digamma(n_x+1) and digamma(n_y+1), then sum of n_x and finally sum of n_y (these latter two are for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • partialComputeFromNewObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromNewObservations​(int startTimePoint,
                                                     int numTimePoints,
                                                     double[][] newVar1Observations,
                                                     double[][] newVar2Observations,
                                                     boolean returnLocals)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data. In particular, this method differs from MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov.partialComputeFromObservations(int, int, boolean) because it operates on a new set of observations (using the old set of observations for constructing the search spaces and PDFs)

        The method returns:

        1. for average MIs (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_x+1), digamma(n_y+1) for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local MIs (returnLocals == true), the array of local MI values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromNewObservations in class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        newVar1Observations - new time series of observations for variable 1
        newVar2Observations - new time series of observations for variable 2
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of sum of digamma(n_x+1) and digamma(n_y+1), then sum of n_x and finally sum of n_y (these latter two are for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
